oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Level Stress recordings: EastMora_90
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kristoffersen, Gjert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Phonology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Recording equipment The recordings were done by means of a cassette recorder (Sony TC-D5M) and Sony lavaliere microphones. They were digitized in the 1990s. The recordings were made in the speakers’ homes.
The speakers The set consists of three speakers, two women from the village of Nusnäs, born in 1925 and 1966, grandmother and grandchild. The third speaker is a man from the village of Garsås, some kilometers further south, born in 1928. They were recruited with the help of the Swedish linguist Gunnar Nyström, who has a thorough knowledge of Dalarna and the Dalarna dialects. The youngest speaker did not grow up in East Mora, but in the city of Falun. Both parents were from East Mora, however, and the dialect was her home language. She also spent her summer holidays at her grandmother’s home in Nusnäs.
For the full background description of this item, see the file "EastMora_90: Background.pdf".
For the full description of the whole project, see these files: The Level Stress recordings.pdf LevelStress_Glossary.pdf Level Stress_Speaker and Sound File Codes.pdf
The data should be used only for research and development purposes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: University of Bergen, Department of Linguistic, Literary and Aesthetic Studies
